dialogues.speaker: EXT. ALLEY. DAY
dialogues.text: ANTHONY and DIGNAN walk down an alley behind a convenienc store. Anthony's nineteen. He's got on a red jacket with Enco patch. Dignan's twenty. He has a buzz-cut and wears short-sleeved terrycloth shirt. He carries a vinyl tennis bag. It's got a pouch for a racquet but no racquet in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What color hair does he have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black hair. Paul Michael Glaser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Making Hutch David Soul?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. The blond guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. That's wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dignan, it's --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plus where's Huggie Bear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not there. Huggie Bear isn't in every single episode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you might of dreamed this one, Anthony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's a real episode. The killer is leading him across the city by calling different pay phones. They climb over a high wooden fence.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BACKYARD. DAY
dialogues.text: They walk through somebody's backyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As part of his plan. I don't know why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, that's what I'm saying. It has the logic of a dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The point is the killer always goes, May I speak to Starsky? He says his name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does Starsky say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says. This is he.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. This is he. They climb another fence. There's big house on the other

dialogues.speaker: INT. HOUSE. DAY
dialogues.text: Anthony and Dignan are inside walking through the foyer. Anthony goes up the stairway quickly and quietly. Dignan walks to the master bedroom. Goes in the closet an grabs a box. Looks inside. Dumps it into his bag. Anthony goes into a bedroom. Looks in a dresser and takes out two watches. Digs through some socks and finds some c Dignan goes in the study. Opens a drawer and closes it. Opens another and lifts out a set of thin leather coin bo Anthony's in a kid's room. Looking at posters of a footba player and John McEnroe on the walls. He grabs a walkman a calculator. Then suddenly stops moving. He crouches dow Looks at a shelf of dozens of little metal soldiers. They in formations with different uniforms. Dignan is walking down the hallway as Anthony comes down stairs. They walk to the door and go out.

dialogues.speaker: INT. DINER. DAY
dialogues.text: A twenty-four hour diner. Anthony and Dignan are eating a the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see what I meant about the window?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kind of. Except we've already got the keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's true. But what if they change the locks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would they do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who knows? That's why I filed it down. Dignan nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that window can never be locked. It's impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, your mind is very good with the more mechanical details. Whereas my strength would be -- A good-looking WOMAN about forty-five years old interrupt them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I use your Tabasco?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Anthony hands her a bottle of Tabasco off the counter. Sh walks away. Down the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't see many women who like Tabasco. They watch her for a minute. Dignan looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's really kind of hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks back at her, nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's an attractive older woman.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BOB'S HOUSE. DAY
dialogues.text: A huge house with a wide lawn. BOB, who's about twenty-si wearing black jeans and a V-neck T-shirt, is spraying dow battered 1972 Mercedes with a garden hose. He's got his shirt off and a towel around his neck. Dignan has an expression of intense concentration as he looks at the ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Bob. What about one of those? Dignan points to a new BMW and a Lexus in front of the ga

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not allowed to drive those.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not even for emergencies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little angry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought your parents were in Italy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So who's going to know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Future Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Futute Man. You know. Cause he looks like he's from the future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks like he was designed by scientists. For desert warfare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That never would of --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's cut the bullshit. Silence. They all look at the car. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's got a V-8, Dignan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think the cops have?

dialogues.speaker: INT. BOB'S HOUSE. DAY
dialogues.text: They're sitting at the coffee table in Bob's great big living room. It's got high ceilings and two Persian rugs. They're eating sandwiches and chips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're that worried, maybe we should just steal one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about, Bob?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you use a coaster. Bob slides a coaster under Dignan's glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ever steal a car bdfore?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I've stolen two cars before. One Jaguar. And one Trans-Am. With T-Tops. That Trans-Am was fun to drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stole a Trans-Am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true, Dignan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. What do you want to do? You want to steal one or just drive your car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinks for a minute)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll just drive my car.

dialogues.speaker: INT. DELI. DAY
dialogues.text: Anthony's playing pinball at a machine in the back of a little grocery store. Dignan's watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anthony, we'll get two hundred for the coin collection alone. That's less than what it's appraised at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Dignan, do you really know that much about rare coins?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know about money, Anthony. I know the value of money. Plus the earrings are worth three times that. Anthony looks at Dignan. Dignan points at the pinball mac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your ball. Dignan tries to hit the flipper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you not to take the earrings. Anthony keeps looking at Dignan. Dignan doesn't look up f the machine. Anthony turns and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got another ball. Dignan watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm playing your game.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. SIDEWALK. DAY
dialogues.text: They're walking fast down the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The list, Dignan. I know you remember the list because you signed it. "Things Dignan was not supposed to touch."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every valuable item in the house was on that list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That doesn't make any difference. I bought those earrings for my mother on her birthday. They have a very special value for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I can't be sorting through that shit in the middle of a burglary. There's just not time for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you shouldn't of gone in there, Dignan. Maybe we should of robbed your house. Did you ever think of that? Dignan stops walking. Anthony looks back at him. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Dignan turns and starts walking the other way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't appreciate you ridiculing me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was I ridiculing you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're making fun of my family. You know there's nothing to steal from my mom and Craig. You know exactly what you're saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what I meant, Dignan. They both see something. They keep walking. Dignan looks back down the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I saw it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm lookout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dignan, it's got an alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so. Just reach on in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sets it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, just do it real quick. (starts down the sidewalk)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll meet you down there. Dignan cuts into an alley. Anthony turns back. Looks at a parked car. Looks left and right. Walks to the car and reaches in the half-open window. An alarm goes off. Anthony unlocks the door and opens it. Leans inside. Grabs a wallet off the seat. A MAN standing on the sidewalk watches Anthony get out of the car. Anthony looks at him, then walks down the sidewa not too fast. He turns down an alley and runs.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. ALLEY. DAY
dialogues.text: Anthony comes around the corner and meets Dignan beside a dumpster. The alarm is still ringing in the distance. Anthony starts looking through the wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It had an alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I heard that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (counting the money)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five, seven, eight dollars. He looks at Dignan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking the wallet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit. What'd I tell you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not bad. Anthony keeps looking at Dignan. Dignan smiles. He hands Anthony a five dollar bill. Anthony looks at it. He takes He puts it in his pocket. Dignan puts out his hand to sha Anthony waits a second. He shakes Dignan's hand for just second and walks down the alley. Dignan smiles and walks behind him.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HAMBURGER PLACE. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Anthony and Dignan are sitting at a table with Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do herbs have to do with it? I don't understand the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pot is an herb. It's just like any type of gardening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much could you grow? Realistically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As much as I want. When these plants bud I'll probably have about six thousand dollars worth of weed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six thousand dollars? Come on, Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should take a look. I have an entire crop in my backyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In your backyard? How do you protect them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's private property. Plus I have Hector.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector woudn't do anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he's got a loud bark. That's the most important thing is a loud bark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's that easy why doesn't everybody grow them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good question. Bob looks at Anthony and Dignan. He suddenly gets worried

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you guys tell anybody about my plants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're paranoid, Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but don't tell anybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you grow cinnamon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Sure, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could make your own cinnamon toast. Bob looks at Anthony for a second. He looks at Dignan. Ba at Anthony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you a fag?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the faggot. Bob turns around to see LITTLE RICHARD, short but muscula wearing a down vest and a baseball cap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little Richard. I don't believe it. They'll let anybody in this place. Sit down. Little Richard sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dignan and Anthony, this is Little Richard. He's crazy. Totally nuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little Richard. Trust me. You're insane. Jesus, this guy used to carry a percussion bomb around in his trunk. You do not want a guy like that loose on the streets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It seemed like a good idea at the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one and only Little Richard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you named after THE Little Richard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stares at Dignan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha! Ha! Ha! Why don't you stick it up your ass. Great group of guys you're hanging out with. Little Richard goes out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that all about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you said that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you he's crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he didn't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on a second. Dignan gets up and walks out of the restaurant. Anthony a Bob look at each other. They start to get up.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. HAMBURGER PLACE. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Anthony and Bob go out the door. Dignan is walking over t station wagon. Little Richard is getting in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little Richard. Wait a second. Hang on. I didn't mean to -- Little Richard opens his door hard into Dignan's legs, th gets out fast and takes off his shirt. Dignan tries to hi him but doesn't connect. They grab onto each other and st knocking around. Another GUY gets out of the station wago Two more GUYS rush out the door of the burger place. Anth and Bob stand back, nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let them fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let them fight. They all watch. Dignan keeps trying to punch Little Richa but he's hanging onto him too tight. They keep spinning around together, moving down the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anthony. Anthony looks at the other guys then moves toward Dignan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. Break it up. Break it up. Little Richard lets go of Dignan. They separate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I separated my shoulder. Dignan is holding onto his arm. He kind of moans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. Hang on. Anthony grabs hold of Dignan's arm. Everybody's watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just pull straight up. .Anthony pulls up hard on Dignan's arm. Dignan tries not yell, then suddenly he's OK and relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it back in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving arm slowly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, man. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm not fighting anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His shoulder went out, man. It's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys better get out of here. Guy #2 pushes Dignan. Anthony turns and pounds him in the face. Right on the nose. The guy goes crosseyed. He falls down with his legs all tangled-up in a strange position. Everyone stands there stunned. Anthony takes a step back. looks up. He and Dignan take off. Bob stands there. Froze Everyone looks at him. Bob looks at Little Richard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob? Bob takes off.

dialogues.speaker: INT. CAR. DAY
dialogues.text: The next day. They're driving with Bob. Dignan's up front He's banged-up from the fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy is fucking insane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I warned you, Dignan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said it like it was a big joke, Bob. Like he's wild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I was saying crazy like a lunatic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that now. He's a fucking psycho.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, don't blame me. I told you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do blame you, Bob. And woah. Look at her. There's a beautiful GIRL on the sidewalk. They drive past

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loop around real fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just turn right here. Bob immediately turns and they drive past the girl again. They don't say anything as they go past her. They all jus look at her. They drive on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A minute later. They've looped back. They're looking for girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd she go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe she turned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There she is. She's on a side street. Bob hits the brakes hard. The gir looks back at them. They back up a few feet and turn down the street. They drive slowly toward the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob, don't be so obvious. The girl keeps looking back at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we might of scared her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just go. They come up, beside the girl. She looks right at them, still walking. Her expression is angry and also a little scared. They drive away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You blew it, Bob.

dialogues.speaker: INT. COFFEE SHOP. DAY
dialogues.text: Anthony, Dignan, and Bob are meeting with TEMPLE. Temple in his mid-fifties, short, heavy, completely expressionle wide face. They listen intently as he briefs them on the intricacies of firearms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gun is a firearm. A pistol is a firearm. But anything you hold in your hand is a weapon. A knife. A wrench. A ballpoint pen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ballpoiht pen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone who tells you a ballpoint pen is not a weapon needs intensive psychiatric treatment. You can stick them in the esophagus. You give them a ballpoint tracheotomy. They nod seriously. Temple laughs.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. FIELD. DAY
dialogues.text: They're standing behind Temple's car in the middle of an open pasture. The trunk is open. Temple's got some guns i metal cases. They draw targets on pieces of paper. Anthon draws a man running on his target. They fire a bunch of different pistols. The last one they shoot's a .44 Magnum They buy it.

dialogues.speaker: INT. BOB'S HOUSE. DAY
dialogues.text: The TV room. There are two big couches and a nice giant T The doors are open onto the balcony. The .44 is on the coffee table. Dignan is sitting there with a map and some diagrams laid out. Anthony and Bob are on either side of Dignan's pointing at a notebook page with the heading "Escape Route."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. Escape route. The most important thing you can have is an escape route. Just in case somebody's tailing us. Or even chasing us, as the case may be --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think we're going to be chased?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a good question. No. I don't. I'm just being hypocritical here. However, I will say -- Bob reaches for the .44.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to take a look at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puts hand on gun)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on This is important, Bob. Anthony and I are responsible for the internal situation. The money and the people. You're responsible for the external situation. The streets and the getaway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my responsibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's your domain.

dialogues.speaker: OK.
dialogues.text: Anthony is making a little man out of a scrap of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now. One thing we need to discuss is timing. Timing is absolutely crucial. What are you doing? Anthony!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Go ahead. Bob picks up the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many bullets can that hold? Dignan grabs the gun away and sets it down out of Bob's r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm paying attention. I just want to look at it for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your fucking problem? You're a shithead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to see how much bullets it takes. Anthony picks up the gun off the table. He clicks the act

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anthony, give me the fucking gun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Dignan. It's not your gun. It's all of ours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I paid for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God DAMMIT. Dignan stands up, grabbing his papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two just don't give a shit, do you? Dignan starts out of the room. Anthony stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dignan, calm down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns back, screaming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're out! I'm not working with either one of you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dignan! Stop! Dignan stops. Looking at Anthony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down. Take a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. You're right. Dignan sits back down and starts spreading out his papers again. Freezes. Looks at Bob. Bob's looking at the gun. B looks at Dignan. Bob looks away. Nobody moves.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. DECK. EVENING
dialogues.text: Anthony and Dignan have moved outside to the hot tub. Anthony pets Bob's dog HECTOR. Bob's brother FUTURE MAN walks up the path from the driveway with his blonde cheerleader GIRLFRIEND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you guys doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. We're just --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seen my brother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's inside. Future Man goes inside. His girlfriend stands there on th deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. She stands there, looking across the yard. Anthony and Dignan sit there in the hot tub, looking around. We hear Future Man's loud voice inside:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddammit, Bob! Get your shit together. Future Man comes back out. He stops by the hot tub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you guys up to tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just hanging around. Future Man walks back out the gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye. She follows Future Man. Anthony and Dignan watch them wal away. Bob comes back out with some drinks. He looks shake

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd Future Man want? Bob shrugs and gets in the hot tub. They sip on their dri Bob's got a Heineken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't get it. Held never understand what we're trying to accomplish here. It's too dangerous for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, in reality it's not that dangerous, Bob. It's only dangerous if you don't know what you're doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but what if some nut pulled gun on you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only nut with a gun is going to be Dignan. Anthony gets out of the hot tub and dives in the pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering, very serious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Bob, Anthony did kill someone. He electrocuted our janitor senior year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He electrocuted someone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was an accidental. I don't want to go into the details. It was just one of those senior pranks that didn't really go right. I mean, obviously, since Swifty's dead. That's why Anthony never graduated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name was Swifty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. One of the nicest old guys you'd ever know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's too bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, when somebody gets electrocuted, their skin starts smoking. At least Swifty's did.

dialogues.speaker: INT. CAR. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Anthony, Dignan, and Bob are sitting in Bob's car, parked the dark. Bob's at the wheel. Anthony and Dignan are in t back. Anthony has on a dark blue ski cap. Dignan's wearin baseball cap with the brim pulled down low. He puts a pie of adhesive tape across his nose and hands the roll to Anthony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm putting a piece of tape on my nose. Anthony tapes his nose. They stare out the windshield. Th alarm on Dignan's digital watch goes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (immediately, dead serious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get lucky.

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. BOOKSTORE. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Anthony and Dignan walk through the shadows in front of a huge bookstore. The lights are on inside. They watch for minute and then go to the front door. Dignan hides behind post. Anthony knocks on the glass. An EMPLOYEE appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I left my sweater inside. The employee shakes his head. He can't hear through the g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have a lost and found? The employee unlocks the door and opens it an inch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I left my sweater in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. I see. Come on in. Anthony goes inside. Dignan comes out from behind the pos

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're closed, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's that guy going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He left his sweater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I left some money in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulls out the gun)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the cash relister. Step away from the door. Dignan goes in. They walk through the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the manager?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the other stocker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's another stocker, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know there's another stocker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob? Dignan points the gun at the employee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he? Where is Rob?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Maybe in literature. That's his section.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Literature. The classics. The MANAGER is locking the door of his office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that the manager?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to manager)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unlock that door. (to Anthony)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check the aisles. Anthony starts walking through the store, checking down e aisle. He picks up a copy of The Air War on Hitler's Germ and takes it with him. He goes through literature and see ROB in travel, kneeling in front of a low shelf with a carton of books beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks up, a little puzzled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why aren't you in literature?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitates)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all full up. Dignan is in the office with the manager and the first employee. He's pointing at a drawer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open it up. The manager opens it. It's full of office supplies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. Open the other. Let's go. The manager opens the other drawer. It's full of cash. Dignan looks at the manager. He looks back at the cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it in one of those. Dignan points at some bookstore bags. The manager picks u little one and starts to put the money in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bigger one, you idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glares at Dignan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't call me an idiot, you punk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. But that bag's too small.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anthony waiting outside the office door. Rob, the first employee, and the manager are sitting against the wall in the office. The manager's got an intense, angry look on h face, staring at Dignan. Dignan hands Anthony five little bags full of money and starts to close the office door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, guys. Just...Sit tight. Dignan closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: INT. CAR. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Anthony and Dignan jump into the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go. Go. Drive slow. Bob drives. Pretty slow. Anthony and Dignan keep looking back out the rear window. They're nervous. Nobody says anything for a block or two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh. Slow down, Bob. Drive natural.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is natural.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at speedometer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good. Keep it at forty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did we get it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be cool, Bob. Be cool. (quickly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make that light. They keep driving. Breathing hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got it. We got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much is there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't count it.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. HAMBURGER PLACE. NIGHT
dialogues.text: A picnic table in front of a hamburger place. Dignan is standing up with his drink in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was Dignan screaming like, Get me a bag!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I was calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about what that guy said?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit. That was scary. In the middle of the robbery. The manager looks at me. Right in the eye. And goes, I'm going to remember you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. He said that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear to God. In a very quiet voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like he meant it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like he would find Dignan. One day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I'm going to hunt you down and kill you. Dignan stands there a minute and lets this sink in. Then finally sits down and they all eat their burgers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really think he'll remember you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. All he'll remember is a guy with a piece of tape on his nose. They laugh smugly.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. 7-11. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Anthony, Dignan, and Bob come out of a 7-11. Bob's got a slurpee. He's carrying the WWII book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you, Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on, Bob. Dignan goes up to Bob and hugs him. Bob's not smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was really good driving. Seriously. I mean it. Bob nods and starts walking away, down the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll see you later, Bob. Good driving. Anthony and Dignan sit on the curb. Anthony's drinking a milk. Dignan's still watching Bob walk alone down the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anthony, he sat in the car and watched a 4-11 in progress. He got what he deserved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was the driver, Dignan. He did what he's supposed to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't realize you were so sensitive to Bob's feelings. Considering I did the plans, you're actually lucky you got --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't even say it, man.

dialogues.speaker: INT. BOB'S HOUSE. DAY
dialogues.text: Dignan and Anthony are following Bob through his house. B is playing his electric guitar, not plugged in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob, will you please listen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to talk about it. Bob strums more intensely. They're walking through the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I admit I was wrong for not telling you before the robbery that your share wouldn't be as equal as ours. But the fact remains me and Anthony were much more exposed to danger. Bob has now come to the big glass patio doors where Hecto sits outside, looking in. Bob keeps playing as he looks a Hector.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, Jesus Christ, Bob. You didn't have some vicious lunatic screaming, "I'm going to remember you!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles slightly, keeps playing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's true. That would give me nightmares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob, I've got nightmares. Bob stops playing. He looks at Dignan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll probably have them the rest of your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that? Anthony opens the door to the patio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? They hear breaking glass somewhere as they follow Anthony onto the patio. A voice yells out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motherfucker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on? Bob sets down his guitar as they go out of the yard to se what's happening.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BOB'S HOUSE. EVENING
dialogues.text: Anthony, Dignan, and Bob go around to the front. Bob's neighbor PHIL runs down the driveway with a wrench in his hand. Phil is short and heavy, wearing a golf shirt. He's got a bloody nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil. What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hysterical)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motherfucker. I'll kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks around, suddenly concerned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? PHIL'S GIRLFRIEND comes running out the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've called the police. Oh, my God, Phil. She reaches to hug him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch me! I swear to God I'll get that guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you will, Phil. There was nothing you could do. All you had was a golf club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're bleeding, man. Sit down. A couple of NEIGHBORS have come over from across the stre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some black man beat Phil up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't beat me up. He attacked me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He took two hundred dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Phil)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tilt your head back. Later. It's dark out now. There's a police car parked acr the street and another pulling over, lights rolling. One the OFFICERS walks across the yard, shining a flashlight the bushes. Dignan is talking with one of the other offic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was probably on drugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They usually are. Two other cops are getting a statement from Phil. Anthony and Bob are listening. Some neighbors are milling around talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as I opened the door I saw him. A black guy. Looking through my dad's tool box. I wanted to trap this guy. So I closed the garage door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's when he hit you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up to sky and concentrating)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He struck me. I fell down. He took my wallet. Then he opened the garage door and ran away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd the window break?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hit it with the golf club. Dignan's still talking to the other cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long do you have to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 26 weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what does that cover?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Social issues. Crime prevention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hand to hand combat? Dignan suddenly looks toward Bob's backyard. The cop nods

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ground defense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh. Anthony's looking up into the treetops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is Dignan doing with that cop? He loves them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a million places to hide around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. They'll never catch the guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil probably provoked him. (looking at Dignan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's he going? Dignan and the officer are walking over to the backyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it was a rustling sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dog. Look out for the dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this dog going to bite?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Shit no. Dignan jumps the fence. The cop looks over and shines his flashlight. Dignan's petting Hector. Hector's calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? I don't know what he's talking about. Bob starts walking across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move. As Bob walks away he is looking back, past Anthony, towar the backyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong? Anthony turns to look. In the backyard. Dignan is looking in the bushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He probably went into the next yard. Shine the light over here. Dignan looks across the yard at the officer. The officer shining the light on the marijuana plants. He looks at Di

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those are... Dignan sprints across the yard and over the gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halt! Sir! Anthony and Bob are standing in the shadows across the street. They see Dignan come racing down the driveway. Th officer is yelling behind the gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill! He's running! The other officers are running from their cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The prowler! That way! The officers run past Dignan, toward the back. Anthony an Bob take off as Dignan runs by. The three of them run ful speed down the street, cutting across yards, between hous They throw themselves over fences and scramble through bu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way to go, Bob!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you they were there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (about to explode)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it's my fault?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be quiet.

dialogues.speaker: INT. BOB'S CAR. DAY
dialogues.text: Bob's at the wheel, Dignan in front, Anthony in the back. They're driving fast down the interstate, past fields and farmhouses. Dignan's drawing out a route in felt tip pen a Texaco roadmap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In all probability nothing would of happened. But why take the chance? That's why I ran. I mean how many plants were even back there? Five? Ten?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There were more than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you just tell them the truth. Those belong to my neighbor Phil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I personally don't need that shit in my life right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obviously. That's why we go on the road. The thing about cops is they have short attention spans.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. GAS STATION. DAY
dialogues.text: Dignan fills up the tank and checks the oil. Bob tests th tire pressure. Anthony does the windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get that credit card from you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like to use that credit card, Dignan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because my mom gets the bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not going to notice, Anthony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to use it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then cut it in half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I keep it for emergencies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anthony, we're on the run. This is an emergency. It's only fair that... Anthony gets in the car. Pause. Dignan reaches into his pocket and takes out a wad of cash. He counts some. Stand there a minute. Goes inside to pay.

dialogues.speaker: INT. CAR. DAY
dialogues.text: Anthony stretches out across the backseat on pillows, playing electronic football. Dignan reads Bob's WWII book Bob eats a Ding-Dong and smokes a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. FIREWORKS STAND. DAY
dialogues.text: A fireworks stand on the side of the highway. The car's pulled over and they're buying roman candles, M-80's, and Black Cats from a KID wearing a baseball cap way back on head. As they get back on the highway Anthony lights a roman candle and fires it from the window. Dignan lights an M-8 and throws it out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. LAKE. DAY
dialogues.text: They drive to a big lake. A dog splashes in and swims for tennis ball. Anthony does some nice dives. Dignan swings from a rope out over the water and lets go. Bob sits on a bench.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. CAR. DAY
dialogues.text: Late afternoon. They're driving on the interstate. Anthon got a copy of Runner's World magazine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's mine right here. See? Anthony lifts up his foot so Dignan can compare his shoe with the picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See if mine are in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at Dignan's shoes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dignan, those aren't running shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, they are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at the treads on those.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They obviously weren't designed for racing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, those treads stink. You'd blow a knee out racing on those.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you guys shut up? God. It's like having two little kids in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really. OK, Dad. But seriously, Anthony. These are fast shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've never had a pair of fast shoes in your life, Dignan. (to Bob)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In fifth grade Dignan used to wear cowboy boots for P.E.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's real cool, Anthony. Yeah, I wore boots. My parents wouldn't buy me any $200 running shoes like yours. I wasn't spoiled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't call me spoiled, Dignan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were spoiled rotten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough. Jesus Christ.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. SIDE OF HIGHWAY. DAY
dialogues.text: Anthony and Dignan are lined up to race on the side of th road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to say it, Bob? Fifty yards away, Bob's sitting on the hood of the car parked on the shoulder. He's reading a magazine. He shake his head without looking up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll just say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On your marks... (waits a second, says very fast:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get set go. They take off. Dignan has the jump, but Anthony pulls pas him. A car blows by going the other way and they keep rac Anthony's out in front as they pass Bob sitting on the ca Bob's watching. Dignan raises his fists into the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points at Anthony)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You owe me fifty bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anthony won. Bob gets in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob wasn't even looking.

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. MOTEL. DAY
dialogues.text: A Holiday Inn. Bandera, TX. Bob's car is parked in front. Inside: Dignan, Bob, and Anthony are checking in. There's teenage GIRL behind the counter. Dignan pays cash. The gi hands over the keys. She's looking at Dignan's shirt:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was that shirt made from a towel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seeing his reaction)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just terrycloth, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I think so.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MOTEL. DAY
dialogues.text: They're walking along the balcony, looking for their room Anthony has on his backpack. Dignan's got his tennis bag. Bob's got two large suitcases, a carry-on, and a garment

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, man. She didn't know anything about shirts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm not saying her. I'm just saying, I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a great shirt. Don't worry about it. They find the room and unlock the door.

dialogues.speaker: INT. CAR. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Driving in a small town. Bob's behind the wheel. Dignan's front. Anthony's in back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Armored trucks are very difficult to steal, Anthony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. But once you get inside you're home free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.. Get back to me on that one. Once your plan is worth a shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a plan. It's just --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually. If you knew the exact route, you could plant explosives under a manhole cover and blow it up as it went over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but you wouldn't have the truck if you blew it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: True. There's a car stopped in front of them. A couple of girls are standing beside it, talking to the driver. Bob can't around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is this? Dignan leans over and holds down the horn for about five seconds. The guy in the car sticks hi s hand out the wind and shoots the finger at them. Dignan sounds dead serious

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ram him, Bob. Bob waits for a nervous moment. He does two quick honks. guy's reverse lights go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hit him! Bob hits the gas and slams into the car. He puts his car reverse and backs up a couple of feet. He leans forward a sees the back of the guy's car. It's all smashed up. The gets out of his car, shaken up, and looks at them. His expression is confused. Bob punches it and flies backward down the street. The guy stands beside his car and watche them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, Bob. What the fuck did you do that for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wouldn't move. They go around the corner. Bob shifts into first and goes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he chasing us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed up, Bob.

dialogues.speaker: INT. MOTEL ROOM. NIGHT
dialogues.text: They're unlocking the door. They go inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think he got my license plates?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looked too shaken-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure he did. We'll have to get new plates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's registered in my mother's name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck possessed you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the one who kept saying ram him. Dignan's walking into the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I meant tap him. As a warning. Dignan closes the door. Anthony lies down on one of the b Bob just stands there.

dialogues.speaker: INT. MOTEL ROOM. MORNING
dialogues.text: The next day. Dignan and Bob are still asleep. Bob's on a folding bed. Anthony's sitting at the table, reading a newspaper eating some cereal from one of those little box where you cut open the sides.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MOTEL POOL. DAY
dialogues.text: Ahthony's swimming laps. He stops and hangs onto the side for a minute. Across the pool he can see a good-looking Mexican MAID about twenty years old standing beside her c looking at him. He waves. She waves and gets back to work A little while later. Anthony's sitting in a chair by the pool, letting the sun dry him off. He's wearing just a swimsuit. Dignan and Bob are fully dressed, standing besi him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dignan, I can't get my hair cut. That's just not possible, all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you're going to have to dye it, Anthony. We've got to hide our identities. Especially after Bob crashed the car. Bob has no reaction to this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Dignan. I'm sorry. I can't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even if it's the difference between some trooper recognizing us and throwing us in prison or not? Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Bob, Samson has decided that his hair is more important than our safety. (screaming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My friend, that is a reckless decision! Let's go, Bob. Dignan starts walking away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob. Are you coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you in a little while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you, Bob.

dialogues.speaker: INT. MOTEL ROOM. DAY
dialogues.text: Anthony's wearing a bathrobe, sitting on one of the beds. The maid unlocks the door and looks inside. She sees Anth and starts to go back out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's OK. Come on in. She goes in and starts cleaning up. Anthony sits down in of the chairs and makes conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hot out, isn't it? Yeah. This is a nice little town. So, what, do you do all these rooms yourself? Or what? I'm Anthony. He puts out his hand. She shakes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inez? She nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me give you a hand with that. He helps her make the beds.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MOTEL HALLWAY. DAY
dialogues.text: Anthony walks with Inez from room to room, helpinq her cl up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you say nineteen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dies y nueve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Yeah. Yo soy dies y nueve. How old are you?

dialogues.speaker: INT. MOTEL ROOM. DAY
dialogues.text: Inez opens the door to one of the room.. They go in to cl it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you ever scared of finding a dead body in one of these rooms?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could happen. This is the exact kind of place where it happens. But I don't want to scare you. Anthony picks up a magazine off somebody's suitcase. He flips through it. Inez takes it out of his hands and puts back on the suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: INT. BATHROOM. DAY
dialogues.text: Inez is putting a new bar of soap in the shower. Anthony picks up some wet towels off the floor. It's cramped in t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People think because they're in a hotel they can act like a slob. It's bad manners. Inez takes the towels. She pulls the shower curtain shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you born in Mexico?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cuba.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, really? That's interesting. Do you prefer Cuba or the United States? Inez is trying to get out of the bathroom but Anthony's i the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scuse me.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MOTEL HALLWAY. DAY
dialogues.text: Inez is pushing the cart. Anthony has his hand on the car

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These towels are still warm. He picks one up and holds it to his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess from the dryer. He hands the towel to Inez. She holds it to her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never met anybody from Cuba before. Inez says a few sentences of very fast Spanish. Anthony n Inez knocks on the door of a room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Housekeeping. A WOMAN about thirty-five years old opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're just checking out. The woman goes back into the room. Inez follows her.

dialogues.speaker: INT. MOTEL ROOM. DAY
dialogues.text: The woman's packing a bag on the bed. Anthony comes in. T woman looks at him. 8he's about to say something when Anthony takes the liner out of the trashcan. The woman's HUSBAND comes out of the bathroom. Anthony picks up some stuff off the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Anthony follows Inez into the bathroom. The husband looks his wife.

dialogues.speaker: INT. BARBERSHOP. DAY
dialogues.text: Diqnan's sitting in the waiting area of a barbershop read a newspaper. We can see Bob out the window, talking on a phone. He hangs up and comes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can go first, Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My brother's in jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BARBERSHOP. DAY
dialogues.text: They're standing next to the spinning striped pole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The weed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's not his. How can they arrest Future Man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They said he's a drug dealer. Bob looks off into the distance. Sickened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those assholes. We got rapes. Murders. Violent crimes every second. And this is what they come up with. (shaking his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're just fucking him because he's from a prominent family.

dialogues.speaker: INT. DINER. DAY
dialogues.text: They're sitting at a table, waiting for their order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think they can make it stick, Bob. I mean, what do they actually have on Future Man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, the marijuana crop is a good start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That could be anybody's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They also found my two beam scale in the garage.

dialogues.speaker: . DIGNAN
dialogues.text: Since when is it a crime to have a scale in your house? Everybody has a scale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops say it's a special kind of scale drug dealers use in selling marijuana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So tell them the truth. What do you use it for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just going to use it to see how much I had. Dignan mulls this over for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long has he been in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then how come they haven't set the bail yet? That's unconstitutional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll have to see when we get back. Dignan looks at Bob for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean get back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, obviously, we got to go back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob, that makes no sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dignan, he's my brother. I can't just leave him there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This could be a trap.

dialogues.speaker: . BOB
dialogues.text: Come on, Dignan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't "Come on, Dignan" me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (louder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not in that car you're not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck, since I got the keys. Bob glares at Dignan. Dignan shrugs. The waitress brings over some glasses of water, ice clinking. Nobody says anything while she sets them down. She walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the keys, Dignan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do that, Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dignan. You're going to give me those keys or you're going to get hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't threaten me, Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddammit, Dignan! It's my car! If you don't give me my keys, I swear to God --

dialogues.speaker: EXT. STREET. DAY
dialogues.text: Dignan drives the car slowly alongside: Bob walking down sidewalk, staring straight ahead. Dignan's, got his windo down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Bob. I understand your loyalty. You're a good person. But right now you're not using your best judgement. Bob keeps walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Future Man would not want you to go to jail I promise you. Just get in the car and we'll talk about it. No reaction. Bob keeps walking straight ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Future Man would never go to jail for you, I'll tell you that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name's not Future Man, Dignan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't even know his name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just get in the car, Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's his name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, Bob. I don't know his name. You know why? Because I don't care. He's Future Man. But I care about you. And to me it doesn't make sense to go back to the scene of a crime. Will you get in the car, Bob? This is stupid. Bob stops walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not your decision and he's not your brother, Dignan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. I only have one vote. We'll go talk with Anthony and figure it out. Pause. Bob gets into the backseat. Dignan looks back at h for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to ride in the back? Bob nods and looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Bob. Get in front. Bob exhales and gets out. He gets in up front. Dignan loo at him for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got a beautiful walk, Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: INT. MOTEL ROOM. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Dignan and Bob open the door and go in. Inside: Inez and other Hispanic MAIDS are sitting at the table by the wind One's about seventeen and a little heavy, the other's in mid-thitties. There's a bunch of glasses and a bottle of on the table. One of the maids is cutting up a banana. In smiles at Dignan. Dignan looks puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. How's it going. Suddenly there's a loud crunching, grinding sound. Dignan and Bob are startled. They look around the room. The soun stops. Anthony comes out of the bathroom carrying the pitcher fr a blender. It's full to the top with yellow liquid. He se Dignan and Bob and stops. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you guys went to get your hair cut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. We didn't. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're making banana daqueris. Anthony holds up the pitcher. Dignan looks at it. Nods. P

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Inez. Carmen. Anita.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inez, this is --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry. (pointing to Bob)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this is my associate Cornelius. A strange expression crosses Bob's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I have a word with you, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MOTEL HALLWAY. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Outside the room. Dignan closes the door. There's three housekeeping carts in the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is going on here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What. What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anthony, we're on the run from the law here. Did you tell these people your real name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I didn't. Dignan, they don't speak English.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Not really. Inez speaks a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the left. Dignan cracks open the door and looks inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's from Cuba.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dignan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (closes the door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anthony. Bad news.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MOTEL POOL. DAY
dialogues.text: They walk around the motel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long are they going to hold him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I don't know anything. Except Phil says they got him. And he's in jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He needs to hire an attorney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no. Look. OK. Let's stay here until we find out what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anthony, I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if Future Man doesn't get let out of jail in 48 hours, then we go back. All right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that makes sense. We'll hang out for a couple of days. Get a little R&R. Make sure Future Man's OK and then get back on the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As long as he gets out OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obviously. That's a given.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that OK? Pause. Bob looks at Dignan. Looks at Anthony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I guess so. They shake hands and start back to the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, now we've got a plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it, Bob.

dialogues.speaker: INT. MOTEL ROOM. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Anthony, Dignan, Inez, Carmen, and Anita are sitting crow around the little table by the window in the motel room. They've got banana daqueris and a bottle of wine. Moonlig comes through the window. Bob is standing up in front of them with a banana daqueri in his hand. He's singing a bl number acapella. He's got a good voice.

dialogues.speaker: INT. MOTEL ROOM. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Dignan and Bob are playing slapjack with Carmen and Anita Everyone's got their hands ready as  Carmen turns one car then the next. Bob's having a conversation in fluent Span with them about Las Vegas. He's talking about the rules a different casinos: Bally's, Caesar's, the Desert Inn. Dignan's paying close attention to the deck. A jack comes and he slams it.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MOTEL POOL. NIGHT
dialogues.text: There's a light in the pool. Anthony and Inez are swimmin Anthony swims around her with his eyes just above the wat He goes under and comes up grabbing onto her. She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does my skin feel soft, Anthony?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (passionate)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, yes. Like silk. .Inez starts to giggle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? (starts laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like silk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God. That does sound corny.  Oh, your skin feels so soft and silky. But it really kind of does. He kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No lifeguard on duty. Swim at your own risk. They look up. Dignan's standng at the other side of the p He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I did save Anthony from drowning once, Inez. Tell her, Anthony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dignan sitting with his feet in the pool. Anthony and Ine are sitting on the steps beside him, in the shallow end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, one day we were playing hot box over at my next door neighbor Mr. Langston's house and Anthony fell in the pool and got knocked unconscious. I had to dive in and save him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was in fourth grade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Langston performed cardiopulmonary recitation. CPR. I've never said this before, but frankly I thought Anthony was dead. The veins in his face were all sticking out. His skin was blue. He truly did look dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After that my parents never let me go to Dignan's again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They blamed my family for everything. They always said Mr. Langston saved Anthony's life. Dignan stares wistfully across the pool. Anthony looks at him for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if it wasn't for Dignan I probably would of died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding, whisper voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...It's true. They're all quiet for a minute. Inez hangs onto the side.

dialogues.speaker: INT. MOTEL ROOM. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Bob's sitting in the room by himself, close to the TV, watching a war movie.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MOTEL. DAY
dialogues.text: The next morning. Dignan bursts out the door of the motel room. He runs across the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch. Dignan runs back into the room. He comes out with Anthony

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gone. He stole the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where was it parked?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right here. Anthony looks around the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That coward. Son of a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he just went to the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He took his stuff. He's gone. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should of seen this. I should of expected it. Bob doesn't have any character. Anthony puts his hands in his pockets. Looks out at the highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He went back for his brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We said 48 hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a long time to be in jail. They stand there in the empty parking lot. Anthony goes inside.

dialogues.speaker: INT. MOTEL ROOM. DAY
dialogues.text: In the room. The blinds are pulled. Anthony's sitting at end of a bed. Dignan's pacing around the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll get him. Don't worry about that. We'll go back. We'll find him. And we'll blow up his car. Or do something. I promise you. Anthony gets up and walks to the bathroom. He shuts the d Dignan follows him over to the sink and sits on the count

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, let's face it. Bob was dead weight. We're a lot better off without him. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But who could expect it? Just like that. Steals the fucking car. What kind of person pulls that -- Anthony opens the door and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob didn't steal the car. He told me he was going. He had to go help his brother. Anthony sits back down on the bed. Dignan's shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When'd he tell you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where was I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He told you and you let him do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He told me because he wanted to know if I wanted to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitates)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you wanted to go? What were you going to do? Just leave me here by myself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I didn't do it, did I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So when you were saying Bob's at the store and acting real suprised, that was just an act. You were just --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob went to help his brother. I understand that and I can't help it if you don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand that if I had a few more friends like you and Bob I'd be dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you say so.

dialogues.speaker: INT. DINER. DAY
dialogues.text: Anthony and Dignan are sitting at a booth. Anthony's got roadmap spread out on the table. There's a long silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you'd gone with Bob you'd probably be in Weatherford by now. Of course I'd be here frantically worrying thinking you must of got kidnapped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't realize you had such an incredible ability to feel sorry for yourself, Dignan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, the world is a little bit colder today. Anthony sits there thinking for a second, stating into sp Then he looks back at his map. He draws some lines in two different colors of felt tip pens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to look at the map? Pause. Dignan kind of looks at the map, without leaning forward. Anthony turns the map more in Dignan's direction Dignan leans forward, looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See. Here's where we are. They look at the map for a minute. Dignan looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know he had it in him. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you could say the child has become the father of the man.

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. MOTEL/TOWN. DAY
dialogues.text: Anthony runs down the sidewalk, cuts across the street, a goes around the side of the motel. He pulls off his jacke as he goes up the stairs. He spots Inez's cart. He walks over to the room she's cleaning. She's in there making th bed. Anthony closes the door and grabs her by her belt. She's laughing and he pushes her onto the bed. He unbutto her dress. She jerks a sheet out of the way. It swings in the air. Then we see Anthony and Inez walking down the sidewalk. H got one arm wrapped tight around her shoulders and she's hers around his waist. They're talking while they walk, going past people in the town. They watch each other walking reflected in a window.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MOTEL. EVENING
dialogues.text: Dignan is doing the butterfly in the pool. Anthony and In walk over and wait for him at the end of the pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going over to this bar if you feel like going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm going to swim. I'll see you later. Dignan treads water. Inez looks at Anthony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you come with us.

dialogues.speaker: OK.
dialogues.text: Dignan gets out of the pool.

dialogues.speaker: INT. MEXICAN BAR. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Anthony, Dignan, and Inez are drinking beers with limes a salt. The mood is good and they're getting drunk. Anthony and Inez dance. Then Dignan and Inez. Mexican-style, stom their feet and clapping. There's a scruffy dog in the bar and he barks at the dancers. Anthony kisses Inez and they whisper to each other. Dignan orders another beer and mov over to the pool table. A skinny Mexican MAN puts his arm around Dignan's shoulder. He's drunk and slurring his wor So's Dignan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, my friend. You in the Army, yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I just have short hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that your chiquita?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, my friend knows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She Chicano, yes? Dignan nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like Chicanos?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. He says something in fast Spanish to the people at his ta and they smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Play pool? For one cerveza. Dignan nods. The guy racks up the balls. They start shoot Dignan makes a hard shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
