dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You a good pool player.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got a little lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your friend? He go with the chiquita? Dignan looks over to the bar. Anthony and Inez are gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is a good looking woman. Dignan ignores this. They keep playing. Dignan finally ma the eight ball. The man shakes Dignan's hand and holds on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess I'll get another Tecate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Si. Tecate. You like to fight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fight. You know. He pulls Dignan in and with his other hand fakes a hard p

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Just pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You Hoto?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulls away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you. You a Hoto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Me no Hoto. Tecate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: INT. BATHROOM. NIGHT
dialogues.text: The bathroom is very small with one bare light bulb. Dign stands at the urinal, muttering to himself. The door opens and Dignan turns around just in time to se the Mexican man throw a hard punch. He hits Dignan in the stomach, punches him in the face. Dignan goes down hard. guy kicks him and curses in Spanish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinche cabrone. Puta madre. The bartender comes in with a bat in his hand and starts talking fast and angry in Spanish. The guy gets out.

dialogues.speaker: INT. MOTEL ROOM. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Dignan's sitting in bed, watching TV. He's got a fat lip a big bruise over his eye. Anthony's sitting in a chair beside him. Inez brings over a glass of water and some ic in a washcloth. She gives the ice to Dignan for his eye. puts the glass of water on the nightstand where there's s fast food layed out for Dignan: burger, fries, an apple p Inez goes into the bathroom, closes the door, and turns o the water. Anthony's sitting there with his hands clasped not looking at the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe he just jumped you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you hand me those french fries. Anthony hands him the fries. Dignan watches the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I'd been there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would of been nice. Anthony looks at Dignan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man. I'm sorry. We just went for a walk --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't really feel like talking about it. The only thing I feel like is getting the fuck out of this place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need a car. For the first time Dignan looks away from the TV, at Anth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have an idea for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inez has a master key to all these rooms, doesn't she? (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think we can do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know we can. It's real simple. We go into a room, grab some car keys and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I'm saying is she wouldn't go for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't need to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Dignan. I just --

dialogues.speaker: . DIGNAN
dialogues.text: Look. I'm ready to get the fuck out of here. It's real torture for me to be here. Getting the shit kicked out of me by Mexicans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one to back me up. Now I have a good idea. So unless you come up with something better --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dignan. I can't do that. All right? I just can't. The bathroom door opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you better think of something. Inez comes back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you, Jerry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring at TV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel great, Inez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kisses her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you later. Inez goes outside. She closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think we need any keys, Dignan. I think I can hotwire a car for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know how to hotwire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I do. Bob taught me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob taught you how to get electrocuted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm serious. He made me a diagram.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. SIDEWALK. DAY
dialogues.text: Dignan's standing on a corner alone. He looks sullen.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. SIDEWALK. DAY
dialogues.text: Anthony walks down an alley. He goes past a beat-up convertible. He stops, hands in his pockets. He looks bot ways. He cuts back to the car, opens the door, and slips inside

dialogues.speaker: INT. STOLEN CAR. DAY
dialogues.text: Anthony's behind the wheel. He hand signals a turn and pu up next to Dignan. Dignan shakes his head as he looks at car. He gets in. They drive through the town. The wind's blowing hard. Anthony smiles at Dignan. Dignan tries not smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dignan sitting in the parked car with the motor running. the side mirror he's watching Anthony and Inez. Anthony's saying goodbye. He walks back to the car and gets in. He puts it in gear and they drive off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you say to Inez? Anthony shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I'll come back for you. I love you, Inez." Anthony is silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I'm going to take you away from all this windexing and making beds." Silence. Dignan exhales and looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. HIGHWAY. DAY
dialogues.text: The car is on the shoulder, raised up on a Jack with the hood open. Anthony's looking underneath the car. Dignan's standing in the middle the road with his hands in his pockets. No cars in sight. Anthony starts messing around under the hood. He tests so wires and connections. He steps away from the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, I don't know anything about cars. Dignan stares down the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really know how to pick them. Anthony walks over to Dignan. He stands beside him for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we better go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't panic, Anthony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not. But there's --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't just run home every time things get tough. First of all, we've got enough dough to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our money situation is not good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clapping him on the back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so spoiled. What is "not good" to you? Only a few hundred --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got sixteen dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not correct. Dignan stares at Anthony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it to me. Pause. Anthony reaches into his pocket and pulls out the money. Dignan takes it. He counts it. He looks at Anthony

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixteen dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the rest? Dignan stares at Anthony. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to give some to Inez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dignan frowns slightly. Pause. He screams:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What! Pause. Dignan runs at the car and kicks the door as hard he can. It makes a big dent. He runs down the shoulder an grabs a big rock. He runs at the car and smashes the rock through the windshield. He stands still. He turns to Anth He walks back over to him, yelling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gave $383 to the goddamn housekeeper! What the fuck is your problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She needed it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A $500 tip! For the housekeeper!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her name's Inez. Stop calling her the housekeeper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what she is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that. But --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in love with the fucking housekeeper!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do, get married? Have a bunch of little idiot janitor brats! And go around scrubbing the -- Anthony slaps Dignan hard in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now listen to me. Dignan punches Anthony is the face. Follows it up with on after another. Anthony ducks and puts his arms out. He fa on one knee. Dignan immediately turns and walks to the ca Anthony stands up. He's got a bloody nose. He stares at Dignan. Not angry. Just weary. Dignan pulls his tennis bag out of the car. He shuts the door and walks down the highway. Anthony walks to the car and takes out his backpack. He pulls it tight around his shoulders. He looks down the highway at Dignan. Then turns and walks the other way, in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. GOLF COURSE. DAY
dialogues.text: A cold day on a nice country club course. Anthony watches Bob hit a hard slide straight into the rough. Bob stands there in a frozen follow-through. Then he suddenly swings his club and hums it down the fareway. He starts to walk back to the golf cart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob, where you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not playing any more golf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause I'm not getting any better. It's a waste of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've only been playing for two weeks, Bob. It takes a long time to learn this game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I'm improving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. You just got to stick with it. Bob looks down the fareway. He takes a deep breath and starts walking toward his club about twenty yards away.

dialogues.speaker: INT. GOLF CART. DAY
dialogues.text: In the cart. Bob's driving. There's a brief silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to talk about it if you don't want to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it must of been a bad experience. But it doesn't sound like it was your fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I didn't mean to electrocute him. But the whole operation was my idea. MONTAGE: Electronics wizardry. Splicing wires. Buzzing electrodes. A filament lights up blue. Pliers and clipper rewire a circuit breaker, short out the P.A. system, electrify doors and windows. Anthony continues in VOICEOV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It took six months of research. I did all the wiring myself. Switched AC to DC. Doubled the voltage. Shorted out the generator. The whole school was shut down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's pretty complicated for a senior prank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like that word prank, Bob. I was trying to do something more than a prank.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. SCHOOL. DAY
dialogues.text: A large school building. Tall oak trees and benches in th shade. Green and blue lights blink in the windows. White flashes and loud jolts of energy dance from room to room. Mozart plays in the distance. Students begin to swarm out into the yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to create an event. Something everyone would remember. And at first it worked perfectly. The whole school was standing around outside. Kids running all over the place. Everybody laughing.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. GOLF COURSE. DAY
dialogues.text: Anthony and Bob are standing on the seventeenth green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even the school custodian Swifty thought it was great. He kept laughing and shaking his head the whole time he tried to disconnect the generator. And then suddenly (snaps his finger)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: total silence except for Swifty hanging off the generator with his leg stuck to it being electrocuted. Anthony stares down the fareway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually he died of a heart attack brought on by the shock. He was an older guy.

dialogues.speaker: INT. GOLF CART. DAY
dialogues.text: Anthony and Bob are driving back to the clubhouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I felt terrible. I'd known Swifty since first grade. He was Dignan's medicine man for Indian Guides. They called each other Rattlesnake and Killer Whale. Whenever Dignan came to visit me he would act like he and Swifty weren't that good of friends, but that was just to make me feel better. The whole rest of the school had turned against me.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BOB'S HOUSE. DAY
dialogues.text: Anthony and Bob are sitting by the pool, drinking beers. Future Man's swimming laps even though it's cold out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At first they were going to charge me with manslaughter. That's partly why I was in custody so long. Sixty days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixty days?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. One minute you're studying Great Expectations and the next minute you're drawing the Holy Mary for some kid who tried to stab his girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why were you drawing the Holy Mary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prison tatoos. I got to be pretty good. It's not like drawing on paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Future Man toweling off. He wears a Speedo swimsuit. He walks over to Bob and Anthony. Anthony's just finishing a drawing of a leaping jungle cat in black and red ink on Bob's shoulder. Future Man stops and looks at them with no feeling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a panther. Pause. Future Man looks at Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's that 700 bucks coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm working on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hard to find it sitting by the pool drinking beer and bullshitting. He walks inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought he didn't have to pay anything because of the technicality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but he still has the aggravation. Three days sitting in a cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you adopted, Bob?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, because you guys don't look alike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I wasn't adopted. Long pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was Future Man adopted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ! No.

dialogues.speaker: INT. CAR. DAY
dialogues.text: Dignan and APPLEJACK are sitting in, a '72 Monte Carlo by the curb two houses down from Bob's. Applejack is a small black man with white hair. It's hard to tell exactly how he is. Around sixty-five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a lot of valuable shit in there, Applejack. The silver and the china. The crystal. And the grandfather clock. Goddammit, I bet that clock's worth ten grand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why the fuck do we need to blow up the car? It doesn't make any goddamn sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just settling an old score. You might say revenge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sounds like a lot of bullshit that'll land us in jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We might have to take that chance. Cause I feel pretty strongly about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that Buckethead? Anthony is walking Hector down the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get down. Anthony does some stretching exercises in the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second. They watch Anthony and Hector start down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Anthony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's your friend Anthony?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like he's staying with Buckethead. That's what I figured. He's probably got his own room. Let's see where he's going. Applejack puts the car in gear. They drive slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get too close. Anthony looks back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop. He saw us. Anthony keeps jogging with Hector.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Did he see us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going too slow. It looks like we're following him. Anthony goes around a corner, down an alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed up. They pull down to the end of the alley. Anthony and Hecto are racing down the alley.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. ALLEY. DAY
dialogues.text: Dignan gets out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anthony! Anthony looks back. He stops running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait up. Dignan jogs down the alley. He stops a few feet away from Anthony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you going? Anthony points down the alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just walking Hector. Dignan looks down the alley. He looks at Anthony. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When'd you get back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. Couple days ago. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to shake hands. Anthony puts his hand out. They shake. Pause. Anthony loo down the alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's in the car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Applejack. You want to meet him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. They walk to the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Applejack. They shake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you, Applejack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Anthony?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear you're a good thief. Anthony shrugs and smiles. He nods.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. HAMBURGER PLACE. DAY
dialogues.text: A hamburger place with no other customers. Anthony, Digna and Applejack are sitting at an outdoor table. It's cold their jackets are zipped up tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just sitting at this bar drinking my drink when this fine chick walks by. She was a living doll. And the big motherfucker who came in with her sees me looking, when he walks by he steps on my foot. Doesn't say shit. Just takes a seat with his lady. Well, I holler out to him, If I was as big as you, ain't no way in the hell you'd of stepped on my foot like that. He just laughed. He says, Little man, take your foot and put it in your pocket. I said, No, how about I take my foot and I stick it up your ass? Man, we went to war right there. I hit him so hard I knocked his nuts in his watchpocket. But this motherfucker wouldn't go down. Then all the sudden, out of nowhere, Dignan came up behind him and smashed a bottle on his head. And that big old boy went down. That's how I met Dignan. Good cat to have on your side. He'll go to war with you. He don't give a fuck. Applelack and Dignan slap hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Applejack would of got him anyway. This was just the quicker war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really hit a guy with a bottle? Dignan takes a little notebook out of his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty much. He kind of fell into me. But wait a second. Dignan opens the notebook on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to look at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's big, Anthony. Real big. It's called Hinckley Cold Storage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's Hinckley Cold Storage?

dialogues.speaker: EXT. HINCKLEY COLD STORAGE. DAY
dialogues.text: Anthony, Dignan, and Applejack are standing in front of a massive structure with ladders and towers and huge doors. Applejack's car is parked behind them. There are trucks lined up along the loading docks. A big sign says Hinckle Cold Storage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Henry has an inside source. We call him Steve. That's where we get our information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Mr. Henry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll meet him this afternoon. He's helping us set it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ever hear of the S. Cooper Trust robbery?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-uh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S. Cooper Trust,in San Francisco?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-uh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Henry pulled that job in 1965. It's famous. Applejack was the wheel man. Did you use this same car, Applejack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, no. This is a '72. I was driving a '63 Pontiac.

dialogues.speaker: . ANTHONY
dialogues.text: What exactly is this place? Freezers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Freezers. Imported foods. Anthony stares at Hitckley Cold Storage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go, Abdul-Shabazz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abdul-Shabazz?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a nickname.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. WAREHOUSE. DAY
dialogues.text: Anthony, Dignan, and Applejack are standing on the sidewa at the front door of an old warehouse. Dignan knocks on t door, then tries the bell. They all wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time did he say to be here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now. Dignan looks in the window. He tries the door. It's locke

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can knock a man out with a six inch punch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feel this. Anthony puts his hand up. Applejack does a short, hard ja Anthony shakes his hand out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whistles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could give somebody a concussion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me feel that. Dignan puts his hand up. Applejack nails it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing his hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow. Shit. A drop of water hits Dignan on the head. He looks up. Mor water falls on him. He gets out of the way. Everyone look up. There's a man on the roof. He laughs, hysterically. T stare up at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the weather down there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Henry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's not. Dignan shrugs. He goes over to the door. Mr. Henry pours some more water on him. A minute later: a steel garage door opens and the man ste outside. He is tall, about sixty years old with white hai clipped short and a trim goatee. He wears black trousers, black shoes, no shirt, and a string of animal teeth aroun his neck. This is MR. HENRY. He puts a towel around Digna shoulders and pats him on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dignan. Good to see you. Good to see you Applejack. (looks at Anthony)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Anthony Adams, Mr. Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is no good. Mr. Henry stares hard at Dignan. He looks to Anthony. He looks back to Dignan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is no good, bringing him here. What are you thinking? What the shit, man? Are you crazy? Mr. Henry stares at Dignan. He looks to Anthony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm pulling your leg. Abe Henry. They shake hands. Mr. Henry points to ROWBOAT, a tall, ol black man standing in the doorway. Rowboat wears a white windbreaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my business manager, Rowboat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a sharp jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: INT. WAREHOUSE. DAY
dialogues.text: The second floor of the warehouse is one huge room painte all white. Mr. Henry and Anthony are playing ping-pong. Dignan watches. Rowboat-and Applejack are on the far side the room playing chess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hard to get much spin with this kind of paddle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's called a racquet, Anthony, and you're holding it wrong. That's ghetto play. Hold it like this. Anthony changes his grip. Mr. Henry serves. The ball clic back and forth. They're both solid players. Anthony whips shot crosscourt and wins the point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, your form is for shit, but you've got a hell of a talent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Mr. Henry serves. Anthony returns. Mr. Henry suddenly fir a scorching shot down the line. Anthony watches it click past him. He looks to Mr. Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice shot. Mr. Henry smiles. He looks to Dignan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Are you in, Anthony? Anthony stands there silent. He looks to Applejack and Rowboat. He looks to Mr. Henry. Then Dignan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm in. Mr. Henry puts down his paddle. Stares at Anthony. Smiles

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, kid. Let's go talk about cops and robbers.

dialogues.speaker: INT. WAREHOUSE. DAY
dialogues.text: The ground floor is crammed with cars. Some have been tak apart. Some are shiny and perfect. Anthony and Dignan wal among the cars and junk with Mr. Henry. They've each got coffee in a styrofoam cup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every once in a while some cat comes to me. He wants to know how I made it. How did I become a success? The first thing I tell them is: follow your instincts. Let your instincts guide you. The second thing I tell them is, for Christ's sake: you got to know your grammar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grammar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean grammar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The basic grammatical rules of robbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean like techniques?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Technique. That's right. Seventy- five percent of your job is crowd control. Seventy-five percent. Do you believe that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I do.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. ROOFTOP. DAY
dialogues.text: On the roof of the warehouse. They're standing near the edge, looking out. Mr. Henry is smoking a joint. He's got a black beret. Anthony and Dignan are listening to him ta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the other hand you got to have the right equipment. I don't care if you're Harry Houdini. You can't pick a lock without a hairpin. Dignan nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to live in that place. Hinckley Cold Storage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Convert it into lofts. OK. Pop quiz. What's the single most important aspect of your job?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The grammar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crowd control. Crowd control. Wake up, guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to need a boxman for this one. But that can be arranged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean a safecracker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. And I'll tell you who we're going to want: Kumar Banijamali.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's damn good.

dialogues.speaker: INT. KUMAR'S ROOM. DAY
dialogues.text: KUMAR is about sixty-five with white hair. He's short and wears a pale-green button-down shirt, dark trousers, and sandals. His room is small and has everything he needs in Books. Little TV. Possessions from all over the world. Kumar sits on his bed. Anthony and Dignan sit in wooden chairs. Kumar stares out the window. They sit for a long silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do you think of the plan, Mr. Kumar? Kumar shrugs. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd love to have you on the team. Kumar nods. He looks at a plant growing by the window. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that? An orchid? Kumar shakes his head. Sighs deeply. Long pause. Kumar suddenly stands up and unbuttons his shirt. He thro it on the bed. He undoes his trousers and takes them off. Anthony looks at Dignan. Kumar takes off his socks, then shorts. He is naked. He walks over to his dresser and tak out a small satchell. He looks around the room. Right at Anthony. He walks quickly toward him. Anthony gets nervou Kumar grabs Anthony's shoulder and lifts him up a little. pulls a towel out from underneath Anthony. He puts his ha on Dignan's shoulder as he walks to the door, into the ha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good plan. He goes out. Anthony and Dignan sit there for a minute. They're a little disoriented.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He seems pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: INT. BOB'S HOUSE. NIGHT
dialogues.text: The foyer of Bob's house. The doorbell is ringing. Bob wa in wearing a velour robe. He opens the front door. Anthon and Dignan are standing on the dootstep. Dignan and Bob shake hands. It's a little awkward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Dignan. How's it going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on in. What you been up to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a whole lot, Bob. They walk through the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too bad about what happened on the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. It is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's not even talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. It was extremely stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't expect an apology and I don't even want one. I just want us to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't fucking believe this guy. An apology, Bob?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, I don't want to go into this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Let's keep it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause you would of let my brother rot in jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said 48 hours!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never agreed to that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob, you're lying!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right! Backyard! Right now! Dignan walks straight to the back door and goes out. He stands on the deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go, Bob! Anthony gets up and tries to calm Dignan down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dignan. Take it easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob! Bob is slowly moving toward the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Dignan. This is stupid. Bob is standing just inside the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Dignan. Look. Let's just -- Dignan grabs Bob's shirt and pulls him out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop, Dignan! Anthony breaks them up. He stands in front of Bob, shield him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't want to fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Diqnan. This isn't -- Dignan gets around Anthony and lands a glancing punch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to fight you, Dignan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dignan, we're friends. Take it easy. Dignan lands another punch. He grabs Bob's shirt and pull him around. Then he starts landing punches. One. Two. The Bob nails Dignan in the shoulder. They grab onto each oth and start fighting hard. They're about the same strength. After a couple of seconds Anthony tries to break it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dignan. Dignan. All the sudden Dignan stops fighting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Stop. Dignan puts his arms around Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No fighting. Dignan turns to Anthony. There's tears in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No fighting. It wasn't Bob's fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, Dignan. It's OK. They all catch their breath for a minute. Dignan hugs Bob again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't your fault, Bob. You had your brother.

dialogues.speaker: . BOB
dialogues.text: I didn't have any choice. They stand there another minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starting to laugh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, Dignan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are we doing out here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Dignan. You went crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look. We want you on the job.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. COUNTRY CLUB. DAY
dialogues.text: The restaurant at Bob's country club, People are dressed golf and tennis. The waiters wear white jackets. and blac bow ties. The whole crew sits at a big table by the front window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me get this straight. You don't play golf and you don't play tennis. So why do you belong to a country club?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a piece of work, Bob. A black waiter about thirty-five, JACKSON, stops by the t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doing, Bob?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Jackson. How's it going? Jackson refills their water glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You keeping out of trouble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at others at table)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This boy's a troublemaker. He used to tear this place apart. Mr. Henry laughs. Bob smiles sheepishly. Jackson stands there for a minute looking around the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your brother was up here the other day. He said you ran away from home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said you ran away from home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I didn't run away. I went out of town. Jackson nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob. Bob looks at Dignan. Dignan's looking across the room. There's Future Man and his friend CLAY fresh from a round golf. They're standing on the other side of the room, looking across at Bob. They're smiling. Jackson picks up empty plates and walks away. Future Man and CLAY walk to Bob's table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fancy seeing you here, Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Hey, Clay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's shaking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing much. Future Man looks at Anthony and Dignan. His smiles fades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's it going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, thanks. Future Man looks at the rest of the crew. His smile comes back. Mr. Henry smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Mapplethorpe. (shaking hands with crew across table)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you. Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to know you, John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackson says you told him I ran away from home. Clay laughs. Future Man smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might have mentioned it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, I'm twenty-six years old I didn't run away from home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, Bob. You were on a secret mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd appreciate it if you didn't go around telling people lies about me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. I'm sorry. (looks at Clay)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got a reputation to think about. Clay smiles. Bob shakes his head. Mr. Henry stands up. Everyone looks at him. He's got a cold but calm expressio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The world needs dreamers, son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The world needs dreamers. To relieve the pain of consciousness. Future Man nods. Pause. Mr. Henry doesn't sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we'll see you later, Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pleasure to meet you, John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitantly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you. Future Man and Clay walk away. Mr. Henry sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope this doesn't offend you, Bob. (looks closely at Bob)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your brother is a cocksucker. Bob smiles. They all smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. That doesn't offend me.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. HINCKLEY COLD STORAGE. DAY
dialogues.text: Dignan's hidden in some bushes, watching the Hinckley Col Storage building with binoculars. Anthony's crouched besi him taking notes in a notebook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. Man in blue jeans just left by southwest door. He is entering a white van. What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eleven fifteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. Mark that down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did. Dignan keeps watching through the binoculars. He suddenly looks back at Anthony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God. Isn't this great? Working on the job. Got a wheel man. Got a safecracker. Good friends with Mr. Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. It's pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like we've finally arrived. Anthony nods. He's writing something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you writing? Anthony shows him a little flip cartoon of a guy pole vaulting.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. PLANNING SEQUENCE. DAY
dialogues.text: We see the team assembled around a table. They're drinkin coffee and looking at pictures, charts, maps, diagrams, tools. Dignan passes out some walkie talkies. They test out some smoke cannisters on the roof. Dignan throws one down. They all run for cover. Applejack and Dignan drive fast through a slalom course i deserted parking lot. We see Kumar working on a safe. He wears a stethoscope an listens to the tumblers. He turns the dial. Dignan is tim him with a stopwatch. Kumar opens the safe. He looks at Dignan. Dignan nods wit serious expression on his face.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. RAILROAD TRACKS. DAY
dialogues.text: Anthony and Mr. Henry are jogging along railroad tracks i the warehouse district. Anthony wears a blue T-shirt and shorts. Mr. Henry looks like a boxer in grey sweats with hood up and a crisp white towel wrapped around his neck a tucked into his sweat top. He's wearing black Chuck Taylo They've both got smooth running styles, though every twen yards or so Mr. Henry rolls his shoulders and gives a qui flurry of punches. An older woman rides a bicycle across tracks. She's not pretty, but she's got a strong face. Pioneer stock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at that woman. She's what? Fifty? Fifty-five? But she hasn't let herself go. I appreciate an older woman who has a commitment to her body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do I. They watch her ride down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me something. What the hell kind of name is Dignan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not really sure. I think it's Irish. Or maybe --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess what I'm trying to say is what the hell kind of person is this Dignan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean what kind of person? He's a good person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, sure. He's a great person, and I'd call bullshit on anybody who said differently. But I wonder if the kid has the goods (taps his temple)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: up here.

dialogues.speaker: . ANTHONY
dialogues.text: (long pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think you're giving him enough credit. I know sometimes he doesn't think an idea through. He gets too excited. But --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As far as I can tell he hasn't thought his life through. He'd be fine cutting my grass or parking my car. But business? (looks at Anthony)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You I can work with. You I could groom. Dignan's not going to make it. Anthony stops running. Mr. Henry stops ahead of him and looks back, jogging in place. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wrong about Dignan. Mr. Henry stops jogging in place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're wrong if you think, I'd turn my back on a friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it. Mr. Henry walks to Anthony and puts his hand on his shoul Anthony knocks it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anthony. I want.to say one thing to you. Mr. Henry looks Anthony right in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations. You passed the test.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Abe Henry double-cross test. You just made a perfect score. Anthony has to recover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a test?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a deep breath. Anthony takes a deep breath. Mr. Henry massages Anthony's shoulders. He takes Anthony's head in his arms and does a quick pull to one side: cracks his neck. Then the other s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does that feel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It feels good. Anthony rubs his hands on his neck and moves his head aro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did Dignan take the test?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, he did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd he do? They start jogging again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he agreed 100% that Bob should be dropped. And he also agreed you were a liability. But he felt his talent would make up for your weaknesses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sounds like Dignan. They veer away from the tracks, picking up the pace, and head into a field toward Mr. Henry's warehouse.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. ROOFTOP. NIGHT
dialogues.text: They're having a party at Mr. Henry's warehouse. There ar tables and a BBQ on the roof, with white Christmas lights strung up and music playing. Anthony, Dignan, Bob, Kumar, and Mr. Henry are there. Plus a couple of young GIRLS, eighteen or nineteen years old. Mr. Henry's got a name ta that says, Hi, my name is Mr. Henry. Everyone's mingling the rooftop. Rowboat is at the grill. Applejack comes up stairs with a grocery bag under his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woah. There he is. Applejack! What it is. Mr. Henry and Applejack shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is my car OK out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love it. He always wants to know if the car's OK. Get a hot dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't eat pork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Super K. Kumar. Come here. Mr. Henry goes over to Kumar and throws his arm around hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know why the fuck we're having a party. The damn job's not over yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, this isn't really a party per se.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't celebrate til it's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: True. Dignan's solemn for a minute. He takes a bite of a hot do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you doing? Dignan hesitates. He takes the hot dog away from his mout He's embarassed. Applejack shakes his head, disgusted. He walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that all about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ramedan. Anthony and Mr. Henry are standing together in a doorway. Henry's got a martini.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you, Anthony. Times like this I get philosophical. What does it mean? What's it all about? Are you afraid to die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that door over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you afraid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I mean, I don't think about it all the time. But once in awhile I kind of go, Woah. Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. Woah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fear of death, The pain of consciousness. (taking a sip)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you mix this martini?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Bob did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob. Bob. That's a palindrome. (laughs uproariously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love palindromes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you afraid to die, Mr. Henry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks right at him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anthony, I'm petrified. Bob is talking to the other girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that sugarless gum you're chewing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not chewing gum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like a piece?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles brightly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Thanks. Kumar and Applejack are sitting at a table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If someone could copy my life story. If I had someone, man, to just write what I talk. I have so many stories. Bestseller, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been all over the Goddamn country. I've seen things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to go to Vegas and do headstands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy. Kumar does a handstand.

dialogues.speaker: INT. WAREHOUSE. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Anthony, Dignan, and Bob are sitting at the table in Mr. Henry's office. Dignan's got plans and diagrams spread ou There's music playing in the next room and we can hear people talking outside the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it, man. Hang on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give him a second.

dialogues.speaker: . BOB
dialogues.text: Hopscotch. The code name is hopscotch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Mr. Henry looks in the door. He's got a glass of wine in hand and a bottle and empty glasses in the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Join the party, fellas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're just going over a few things. Mr. Henry looks at the plans on the table. He sets down t three glasses and pours some wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you something, Dignan. It is possible to overplan. You don't want to turn the crew into robots. Right? Dignan nods seriously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got to have fun with it. There's no point if you're not having any fun. Would you like me to be there tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (immediately)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I think --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, if I go out on this job, then it's just another score by Mr. Henry. And I don't see it like that. This is your job. Your creation. I want you to try this. They all try the wine. Mr. Henry watches their reactions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to ask a favor, boys. One day, when I'm long gone and all but forgotten, make one last toast to Abe Henry. And remember me as a friend. They drink.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. ROOFTOP. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Back on the roof. Bob and Dignan are sitting at a table w one of the girls. Applejack is dancing with another. Kuma talking to Reudi. Anthony and Mr. Henry are standing at t edge of the roof, looking out at the city. Mr. Henry's smoking a joint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's just it, Anthony. A lot of criminals have problems. Some of them are alcoholics. Some have drug problems. Others dome from broken homes. I see a real need for healing. Mr. Henry passes the joint to Anthony. Anthony smokes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're thieves. It's what you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an esoteric journey. Anthony passes the joint back to Mr. Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're renegades from despair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I ask you something, Mr. Henry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you want to help us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inhales, pause, holding in smoke)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I was like you once. And there was no one there to help me. Mr. Henry exhales the smoke. He hands the joint to Anthon Anthony takes a hit. They stare out at the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: INT. BOB'S HOUSE. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Anthony and Dignan are sitting in the kitchen. Anthony's on a t-shirt and boxers. Dignan's wearing a bathrobe. All the lights in the house are out except one in the kitchen Anthony's drinking a glass of milk. Dignan's got orange j

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next week we'll be drinking piГ±a coladas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hopefully this trip'll go a little smoother than the last one. Dignan nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or I might end up with a broken nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did that hurt? Anthony shrugs. There's a long silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This'll be a good trip. Anthony nods. Pause. He smiles slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll try not to hold you back tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think you will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to be too much of a liability.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you're going to do fine. It's OK to be scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs slightly, shaking his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I ever said this to you. But it meant a lot to me the way you were after that Swifty stuff happened. Silence. Dignan's a little embarassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was a nice guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was all right. They both sit there for a minute. Quiet. Anthony sips his milk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you like Inez?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a person?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. As a girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do I. Bob comes into the kitchen in his bathrobe looking haggar yet wired. Anthony and Dignan look at him. He goes to the refrigerator. He takes out a chocolate cake and a carton milk. He pours himself a glass of milk. He goes over to t table with the cake and sits down. He cuts himself a piec of cake. He swallows two pills, one at a time, each with long drink of milk. The pills are big capsules and he struggles a little when he swallows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You OK, Bob?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snaps)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm having a heart attack. Of course, I'm OK. What's that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. I was just asking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Bob. Bob senses that's he's over-reacted. He backtracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I know. I'm just saying. I feel fine. You want a piece of cake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Bob starts to cut him a piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take one of those, too, please.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. HINCKLEY COLD STORAGE. DAY
dialogues.text: Anthony is positioned behind some bushes, across from the building. He's wearing a black parka. He looks through so binoculars. Re pulls out his walkie talkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bird Dog to Scarecrow. Bird Dog to Scarecrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead, Bird Dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're all clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all set?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on a second. Anthony waits a second. We see Dignanr Applejack, and Kumar getting out of the ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into walkie talkie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. Let's do it. Dignan starts to move out. He remembers something. Says b into his walkie talkie:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get lucky, Bird Dog. Dignan, Applejack, and Kumar start across the parking lot Dignan's got on a business suit. Applejack has on sunglas Kumar is carrying a leather satchel. They go in the side door and down a narrow passageway. Th get into the freight elevator and go up. Bob's voice come through on Dignan's walkie talkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarecrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? We see Bob: standing on the loading dock behind the build He's wearing an extremely heavy wool jumpsuit with a hood

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. We're in the elevator. How's it look back there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks pretty good. There's nobody back here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand by. Bird Dog? We see Anthony: still in the bushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your second position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. Roger. Anthony gets up and starts out across the parking lot, ha in his pockets, not too quickly. Dignan, Kumar, and Applejack get off the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. Six minutes. Applejack goes one way down the hall. Dignan and Kumar go the other. They turn the corner. They go down a wide passageway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did he go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? Applejack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did he go that way? (points back down hall)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going to watch the back stairwell, remember? (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it. Dignan and Kumar come up to a door. Dignan slides a crowb out of his jacket. He snaps open the door. They go in. It a small office with a desk and a little safe in the corne Dignan clears everything off the desk with one quick swee of the arm. He puts down the briefcase and opens it up. I full of tools. Kumar unzips his satchel and takes out a r of tape. He immediately sets to work on the safe. Dignan steps back out the door and closes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into walkie talkie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bird dog? You in position? We see Anthony on top of a fire escape, about four storie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in position, Scarecrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any activity?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all. The place is totally deserted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. It's supposed to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a great view up here. I can see all the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand by, Bird Dog. We see Dignan standing in the hall, outside the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacknife. Come in, Jacknife. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Bob? Are you there? We hear the sound of an elevator moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob? What the fuck is going on? Anthony? Who's in the elevator? We see Anthony on the fire escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check the fucking elevator. It's moving. Anthony goes in a little door. Down a passageway. Through freezer. Into a corridor. Past the freight elevator, whic is open on this floor. Then around a corner to a smaller elevator as it opens: Bob's inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My walkie talkie's busted. 1 can't tell what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see it. (fiddling with it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you drop it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Dignan's still standing in the hall as Anthony and Bob co around the corner. Dignan yells at them down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening? What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was Bob. His walkie talkie's busted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't hear anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's watching the door? What the fuck are you doing? Get back in position. The elevator starts whirring again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did that? What the fuck is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's going back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pannicking, into walkie talkie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Applejack! What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob! Get back in position! For just a second we hear the sound of music playing. Everyone freezes. FOUR GUYS, two of them in jumpsuits lik Bob's, step out into the corridor. They've got bags from Jack in the Box. They're drinking drinks and shakes. One them is holding a jam box. They stop. Dignan pulls out hi gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move! Get up against the wall! Anthony and Bob pull out their guns and hold them on the four guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into walkie talkie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're back! Get down here! (not into walkie talkie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We work here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checks watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two minutes. Simultaneously: Kumar opens the door. Applejack comes running down the hall with his gun out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd they come from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bob)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where were you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My walkie talkie broke. Applejack reaches in his pocket and pulls out a dark blue nylon stocking. He pulls it over his head. Dignan, Anthon and Bob immediately do the same. Anthony's is red. Dignan steps into the office with Kumar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't get it. It won't... (make s gesture)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can we do? Kumar looks at his tools. Moves them around on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. Fuck it. He goes back into the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go. Fuck it. TWO GUYS with a cart stop at the end of the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get against the wall! Bob's gun goes off. Everybody looks at him. Dead silence. Bob looks around like it must have been somebody else's g that went off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't do anything. Applejack falls to his knees. He drops his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Applejack? Are you OK? Applejack clutches his arm and rolls onto his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with Applejack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's having a heart attack or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go! Dignan throws down his smoke cannister. Bob and Anthony automatically throw down theirs. Smoke instantly fills th hall. The hostages stand completely clear of the smoke. They wa Anthony, Dignan, and Bob rush around blindly in the haze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me move him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful. Check his pulse. Anthony holds all the guys at gunpoint. Dignan and Bob ca Applejack down the hall, into the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: . DIGNAN
dialogues.text: Is he breathing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so. An alarm starts ringing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ.  What the fuck is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't think there was an alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take him to the car, Bob. Dignan runs back down the hall to Anthony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who tripped the alarm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the fire alarm.  Somebody pulled the fire alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Kumar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, Anthony.  Did you lose him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in the freezer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He went in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for? The guy on the floor kind of shrugs.  Anthony crosses the hall. He pulls open one of the big freezer doors. Kumar i standing there with his bag and the briefcase.  You can s his breath in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go. Come on. They go down the hall to the freight elevator.  They star down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you doing in there? Kumar shakes his head and shrugs his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. HINCKLEY COLD STORAGE. DAY
dialogues.text: They go out the front door, across the parking lot. Kumar lagging behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait for Kumar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Kumar. They come up to the car. Anthony tries the door. It's loc Bob comes running around the side of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator broke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Applejack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's stuck between two floors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Applejack's stuck in the elevator?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's got the car keys? Everyone looks at everyone else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Applejack drove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run. Run. Let's go. Bob takes off at a sprint. Kumar follows him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Dignan. Anthony pulls off the red stocking and throws it down. He tries the other doors on the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck happened to the the plan? Dignan pulls off his stocking. Anthony starts walking fas across the parking lot. Dignan stands still by the car. Staring straight ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's not enough time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, there is. Let's get organized. Dignan starts toward the building. Anthony moves after hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dignan, it's too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so. Dignan and Anthony look at each other for an instant. Dig turns and sprints back into the building. Anthony stands alone in the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a bedroom with big French windows. No furniture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a wood-panelled study. Stripped bare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: an elegant dining room. Cleaned out.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BOB'S HOUSE. DAY
dialogues.text: A GUY in a moving company uniform carries a Louis XIV cha out the front door of Bob's house, down the path to the street. Two other MOVERS pass him on the way. They've got dolly. The guy carries the chair into a huge moving van. It's fu of furniture and paintings. Mr. Henry and Rowboat are standing in the street. Rowboat smoking a cigarette, writing on clipboard. Hector stands behind them in the grass. Mr. Henry takes out two cigars. holds one out to Rowboat. Rowboat shakes his head. Mr. He shrugs and lights one for himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Rowboat. People who smoke cigarettes die. People who smoke cigars just keep on going. Rowboat nods, smoking. Mr. Henry looks at Hector. He poin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit. Hector sits. Mr. Henry smiles a broad smile. The movers g buy with a beautiful Moroccan divan.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. HINCKLEY COLD STORAGE. DAY
dialogues.text: Dignan comes out the front door pulling Applejack, semi- conscious, to the car. Dignan loans Applejack against the door. He checks Applejack's pockets for the keys. He look around on the ground. He hears sirens in the distance. He looks across the park lot. Two squad cars screech in off the street. Dignan takes off into the building.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HINCKLEY COLD STORAGE. DAY
dialogues.text: Dignan sprints down the corridor. Races up the stairs. Ru down hall after hall. Two COPS appear out of the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze! Dignan ducks into a stairwell. He runs down the stairs an into another corridor. He can hear cops yelling from two different directions. He crosses a catwalk. Cuts through office. Pulls open a door and goes into one of the freeze rooms. Cops come yelling down the hallway. Dignan runs through t freezer room and tries the other door. It's stuck. Three COPS come inside. Dignan instantly puts his hands up in t air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop the fucking gun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move! Dignan drops the gun. The cops rush him. They nail him in the wall. Get him in a headlock, pulling hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're caught, buddy. They pull him into the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put your hands behind your back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to do anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (squeezing his neck)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you try to run, buddy? Don't you know what freeze means? Don't you speak fucking English?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy. They put him face down on the floor and cuff him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dignan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down. They move him down the corridor. Dignan's nose is bleedin He looks terrified. Applejack is sitting propped up against the wall. He's go an oxygen mask on his face and a team of paramedics and c around him. Somebody's taking his blood pressure. Another one's giving him an IV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anthony running down a sidewalk. He drops his gun in a trashcan without slowing down. He crosses a bridge and ru into the the trees.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. COUNTY JAIL. DAY
dialogues.text: There's snow in the air. The prison yard is wide with dry grass and concrete. It's split up by chain link fences. Guards sit in the towers. Dignan's wearing an inmate jumpsuit. Anthony and Bob walk with him across the yard. They've brought along two bags food from a hamburger place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said to the DA, That cop who hit me must of given me CRS disease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's just what the DA asked. CRS is a disease where you can't remember shit. Dignan smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like amnesia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't remember shit. CRS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Anthony kind of smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell Mr. Henry I said that. Anthony nods. Silence. They walk past a bunch of guys lifting weights on the other side of a fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So is Mr. Henry going to come by and see me or anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so. I mean. Actually, he robbed Bob's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got to be kidding me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd he get?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty much everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The grandfather clock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He got everything. Dignan nods. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. (pause, looks at Bob)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Bob. Bob shrugs, looking at the ground. Dignan looks to Anthon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think Applejack knew?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We haven't heard from Applejack since he got out of the hospital. His case got dismissed. Dignan's stunned to hear this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We think Mr. Henry maybe --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His health isn't very good, you know. They take that into account. Pause. Dignan nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. That's true. Long silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Henry never gave you a test, did he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a picnic table in the prison yard. There's frost on the ground. They're eating lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're living on a sailboat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It belongs to Bob's uncle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How big is it?

dialogues.speaker: . ANTHONY
dialogues.text: Oh, I'd say about --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's in the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Temporarily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind Bob's house. Long pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it float?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not sure yet. It's going to need some repairs. Dignan nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how is it in there? (pointing at cell block)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I say? It's jail. You don't sleep when you want to. You don't eat when you want to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have your own room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have rooms, Bob. We have cells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have your own cell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I have a cellmate. His name's Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he in for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stole a tractor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do they let you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't really want to talk about it, Bob. Long pause. Anthony takes a sip from a milkshake. Dignan unwraps the foil from a cheeseburger. He takes a bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with his mouth full of food)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This sure beats the shit out of the shit they crap out in this joint. Anthony and Bob laugh. Dignan takes another huge bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might have to have another one of these.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dignan in handcuffs behind a chain link fence. He's stand in line with some other inmates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for coming. Anthony nods. They stand there in silence. The line moves forward a few steps. Anthony and Bob walk with Dignan on other side of the fence. The line stops. Pause. Dignan leans toward the fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. He motions for them to come closer to the fence. He whisp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I may have found a way out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh. Wait for my instructions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dignan, I -- The line starts moving. Anthony and Bob walk with Dignan the other side of the fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When we go through the next gate you'll have 30 seconds to take out the tower guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have the car running at the north- west checkpoint. Bob and I'll --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dignan, I -- The line starts moving faster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scale the barricade and tunnel through no man's land. And Bob. Remember:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scale the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shield me from the bullets. They won't shoot civilians. Ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now! Anthony and Bob look all around in a panic. They look to Dignan. Dignan shuffles along with the rest of the inmates. He lo at Anthony and Bob. He smiles. He shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So long. Bob and Anthony slowly half-smile. They wave to Dignan as the line of inmates turns away. Anthony looks to Bob. Bob smiles. The line of inmates stops about fifty feet away. Dignan looks back. Anthony looks at him. Dignan's expression has changed. He wasn't expecting them to see it. His eyes loo cold. Anthony puts his hand on the fence. Dignan turns an the line of inmates disappears into the cell block. Anthony stands there in silence.. He lets go of the fence He walks with Bob down the long path in the cold air.
